head.title: MetroStars Remain On a Winning Roll

hedline.hl1: MetroStars Remain On a Winning Roll

block.p: Steve Jolley, Tab Ramos and Adolfo Valencia scored goals as the MetroStars beat the Colorado Rapids, 3-1, yesterday in Denver.
Goalkeeper Mike Ammann made eight saves to help the MetroStars improve to 8-7-1 with their sixth victory in their last eight games. Colorado dropped to 7-9-1.
Steve Jolley, Tab Ramos and Adolfo Valencia scored goals as the MetroStars beat the Colorado Rapids, 3-1, yesterday in Denver.
Goalkeeper Mike Ammann made eight saves to help the MetroStars improve to 8-7-1 with their sixth victory in their last eight games. Colorado dropped to 7-9-1.
Jolley opened the scoring in the ninth minute to end Colorado goalkeeper Adin Brown's 204-minute shutout streak. Ramos made it 2-0 in the 43rd minute, and Valencia scored in the 48th.

ITALY AND PORTUGAL ADVANCE: Italy advanced to the semifinals of the European Championship, beating Romania, 2-0, yesterday in Brussels as Romania's captain, Gheorghe Hagi, was ejected from his final international game.
Francesco Totti and Filippo Inzaghi scored for Italy, which plays Thursday against the winner's of today's quarterfinal between the Netherlands and Yugoslavia.

In yesterday's other game, Portugal beat Turkey, 2-0, at Amsterdam on a pair of goals by Nuno Gomes. Portugal plays Wednesday against the winner of today's game between the world champion, France, and Spain.
